titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Civic Repertory Theatre Records
titlestmt.author: by Susan Brady

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday January 23, 2019 at 04:26

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Civic Repertory Theatre Records consist of production files containing scripts, promptbooks, technical production documentation, manuscript and printed music, and photographs; financial records including auditor's financial statements, box office receipts, weekly financial statements, and ledgers; programs, issues of the Civic Repertory Theatre Bulletin/Magazine and other printed material; notebooks containing Eva Le Gallienne's translations of plays by Henrik Ibsen; and pressbooks and scrapbooks. Also found are materials documenting some of Le Gallienne's post-Civic Rep productions, including photoduplications of costume designs by Patricia Zipprodt for Le Gallienne's 1982 revival of Alice in Wonderland , as well as a small group of material relating to the Bonstelle Playhouse of Detroit, Michigan, which documents the work of actor Donald Cameron, also a member of the Civic Repertory Theatre.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Eva Le Gallienne, 1960, 1964, 1983, and Thelma Chandler, 1962.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Civic Repertory Theatre Records are the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Civic Repertory Theatre Records. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization.

bioghist.head: Civic Repertory Theatre
bioghist.p: The Civic Repertory Theatre was established by Eva Le Gallienne in New York City in 1926. Le Gallienne directed and acted in most of the rotating repertory of classical plays. The company disbanded in 1933, and Le Gallienne continued to act and direct stage productions, including a 1982 revival of Alice in Wonderland .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Civic Repertory Theatre Records consist of production files containing scripts, promptbooks, technical production documentation, manuscript and printed music, and photographs; financial records including auditor's financial statements, box office receipts, weekly financial statements, and ledgers; programs, issues of the Civic Repertory Theatre Bulletin / Magazine and other printed material; notebooks containing Eva Le Gallienne's translations of plays by Henrik Ibsen; and pressbooks and scrapbooks. Also found are materials documenting some of Le Gallienne's post-Civic Rep productions, including photoduplications of costume designs by Patricia Zipprodt for Le Gallienne's 1982 revival of Alice in Wonderland , as well as a small group of material relating to the Bonstelle Playhouse of Detroit, Michigan, which documents the work of actor Donald Cameron, also a member of the Civic Repertory Theatre.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into six series: I. Production Files, 1925-1982. II. Financial Records, 1926-1935. III. Pressbooks, 1923-1962. IV. Administrative Files, 1926-1964. V. Photographs, 1917-1953. VI. Eva Le Gallienne Writings and Memorabilia, 1932.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by title of production.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Files for each production may contain scripts, promptbooks, material relating to design and technical aspects of the production, photographs, and music.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes photoduplications of costume designs by Patricia Zipprodt for the 1982 revival of Alice in Wonderland

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically within type of record.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of materials documenting the finances of the Civic Repertory Theatre, including ledgers maintained by staff and statements from the company's auditors.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of pressbooks containing press clippings relating to Civic Repertory Theatre productions and company members. The pressbooks are accompanied by a scrapbook containing examples of stationery and other Civic Repertory Theatre printed items.

did.unittitle: Eva Le Gallienne press books and loose clippings

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: See also Oversize box 33, Portfolio 33, and Broadside 34

did.unittitle: Scrapbook of examples of Civic Repertory Theatre printed ephemera

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of material relating to the administration of the CRT, including information on company personnel, performance schedules, and publications by and about the Civic Repertory Theatre.

did.unittitle: Civic Repertory Theatre Bulletin / Civic Repertory Theatre Magazine
Bibliography of articles about the Civic Repertory Theatre
Galleys for Alice in Wonderland as performed by the Civic Repertory Theatre (Samuel French)
Galleys (incomplete) for Camille as performed by the Civic Repertory Theatre (Samuel French)
National Repertory Theatre program from Shubert Theatre (New Haven, Connecticut)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains photographs of company members, production photographs, costume designs, as well as photographs of non-Civic Repertory Theatre productions including those of the Bonstelle Playhouse of Detroit in which Donald Cameron was involved prior to his work with the Civic Repertory Theatre.

did.unittitle: Costumes designs of Russian army officers
Bonstelle Playhouse (Detroit) company members (including Donald Cameron)
Eva Le Gallienne Writings and Memorabilia

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the writings of dramatic criticism and memoirs by Le Gallienne and others. The writings are accompanied by a scrapbook about Le Gallienne compiled by A. M. Weil as a gift to her.

did.unittitle: Notes on, and translations of, Ibsen plays [for Modern Library publication]
Notes on the history of the Civic Repertory Theatre
"My Friendship with Ibsen" by Emelie Bardach
